New Records: Kusal Mendis' 77-ball 122-run knock was the fastest hundred by a Sri Lankan in World Cup history.
Sri Lanka posted their highest World Cup total against a Full Member.
Key Match Events: Kusal Mendis scored 122 runs off 77 balls, including six maximums and 14 fours.
Sadeera Samarawickrama scored his maiden ODI ton with a 89-ball 108.
Hasan Ali claimed four wickets for Pakistan with figures of 4/71.
Haris Rauf took 2 wickets for 64 runs.
Shaheen Afridi and Shadab Khan struggled with their bowling, conceding 66 and 55 runs respectively.
Pathum Nissanka scored 51 runs, contributing to a 102-run partnership with Mendis.
Mendis and Samarawickrama had two 100-plus partnerships, taking Sri Lanka past the 200-mark in the 28th over.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch slowed down towards the end, helping Pakistan limit Sri Lanka to under 350 runs.
